00035 namespace {
00036   const int BUFFER_SIZE = 32768;
00037 }

00039 
00040 const char *CommandCopyFromLocal::ms_usage[] = {
00041   "copyFromLocal <src> <dst>",
00042   "",
00043   "  This program copies the local file <src> to the remote",
00044   "  file <dst> in the DFS.",
00045   (const char *)0
00046 };

00048 
00049 int CommandCopyFromLocal::run() {
00050   DispatchHandlerSynchronizer sync_handler;
00051   int32_t fd = 0;
00052   int error = Error::OK;
00053   EventPtr event_ptr;
00054   FILE *fp = 0;
00055   size_t nread;
00056   int src_arg = 0;
00057   uint8_t *buf;
00058   StaticBuffer send_buf;
00059 
00060   if (m_args.size() != 2) {
00061     cerr << "Wrong number of arguments.  Type 'help' for usage." << endl;
00062     return -1;
00063   }
00064 
00065   if ((fp = fopen(m_args[src_arg].first.c_str(), "r")) == 0) {
00066     perror(m_args[src_arg].first.c_str());
00067     goto abort;
00068   }
00069 
00070   try {
00071   fd = m_client->create(m_args[src_arg+1].first, true, -1, -1, -1);
00072 
00073   // send 3 appends
00074   for (int i=0; i<3; i++) {
00075     buf = new uint8_t [BUFFER_SIZE];
00076     if ((nread = fread(buf, 1, BUFFER_SIZE, fp)) == 0)
00077       goto done;
00078     send_buf.set(buf, nread, true);
00079     m_client->append(fd, send_buf, 0, &sync_handler);
00080   }
00081 
00082   while (true) {
00083 
00084     if (!sync_handler.wait_for_reply(event_ptr)) {
00085       HT_ERRORF("%s", event_ptr->to_str().c_str());
00086       goto abort;
00087     }
00088 
00089     buf = new uint8_t [BUFFER_SIZE];
00090     if ((nread = fread(buf, 1, BUFFER_SIZE, fp)) == 0)
00091       break;
00092     send_buf.set(buf, nread, true);
00093     m_client->append(fd, send_buf, 0, &sync_handler);
00094   }
00095 
00096 done:
00097   m_client->close(fd);
00098 
00099   }
00100   catch (Exception &e) {
00101     HT_ERRORF("%s", e.what());
00102   }
00103 
00104 abort:
00105   if (fp)
00106     fclose(fp);
00107   if (error != 0)
00108     cerr << Error::get_text(error) << endl;
00109   return error;
00110 }
